story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled at the foot of a great mountain, there lived a kind and wise Buddhist monk named Thich Hanh. Thich Hanh was known throughout the land for his gentle nature and his deep understanding of the teachings of the Buddha.

One day, a young boy named Tinh came to the village with his family. Tinh was a curious and adventurous boy, always eager to explore the world around him. He would often wander into the forest, where he would spend hours playing and discovering new things.

One day, as Tinh was wandering through the forest, he came across a beautiful bird with shining feathers of every color. The bird was perched on a branch, singing a sweet and melodious song. Tinh was so captivated by the bird's beauty and song that he wanted to keep it as his own.

Tinh climbed the tree and tried to catch the bird, but every time he got close, the bird would fly away to another branch. Tinh followed the bird for hours, but no matter how hard he tried, he could not catch it.

Finally, exhausted and disappointed, Tinh sat down under a tree and began to cry. Thich Hanh, who had been watching from afar, came over to Tinh and asked him what was wrong.

Tinh told Thich Hanh about the beautiful bird and how he had tried to catch it, but could not. Thich Hanh listened carefully and then said, "Tinh, the bird is not something that can be owned or possessed. It is a free spirit, meant to fly and sing in the forest. If you truly want to appreciate its beauty, you must let it go and allow it to be free."

Tinh thought about Thich Hanh's words and realized that he was right. With a heavy heart, he let the bird go and watched as it soared into the sky, singing its beautiful song.

From that day on, Tinh spent many hours with Thich Hanh, learning about the teachings of the Buddha and the importance of compassion, generosity, and living in harmony with nature.

As Tinh grew older, he became a kind and wise person, just like Thich Hanh. He always remembered the lesson he learned that day in the forest, and he made sure to always treat all living things with kindness and respect.

And so, Tinh lived a happy and fulfilling life, always mindful of the importance of living in the present moment and cherishing the beauty of the world around him.

As you drift off to sleep tonight, my dear son, I hope this story reminds you of the importance of treating all living things with kindness and respect. May you always be mindful of the present moment and cherish the beauty of the world around you. Goodnight, my dear son. May you be happy and at peace.

Note: Thich Hanh is a real life Vietnamese Buddhist monk, who is known for his teachings on mindfulness and peace.
